comments:
This is more of a tracking bug than anything given that there is no predictable repro case. We've seen this very infrequently, but enough times to warrant a bug: there is an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException thrown when different threads are outputting log statements (for example, debugging options are enabled on the Auto Build Job and, say, a UI component). 

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 58
    at java.util.ArrayList.remove(ArrayList.java:393)
    at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogReader.addEntry(LogReader.java:183)
    at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView.pushStatus(LogView.java:578)
    at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView.logging(LogView.java:572)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform$2.run(InternalPlatform.java:856)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1044)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.log(InternalPlatform.java:859)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Log.log(Log.java:56)
fixed by synchronizing addition of log entries.
